sprichwort.text: Never play with the feelings of others, because you may win the game, but the risk is that you will surely lose the person for a life time.
sprichwort.author: Shakespeare

sprichwort.text: Positive thinking is at worst a zero-sum game.
sprichwort.author: Ferstl

sprichwort.text: Shared joy is double joy.
sprichwort.author: Cicero

sprichwort.text: Those who are happy feel. Those who are unhappy think.
sprichwort.author: Blanck

sprichwort.text: It would be easier to make everyone rich than to make everyone satisfied.
sprichwort.author: Wertheimer

sprichwort.text: Freedom is worth nothing if it does not include the right to make mistakes.
sprichwort.author: Gandhi

sprichwort.text: A cheerful person is like sunshine in the house.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: People don't stop playing because they grow old; they grow old because they stop playing!
sprichwort.author: Holmes

sprichwort.text: Our feelings are always aroused before our intellect.
sprichwort.author: Wilde

sprichwort.text: Foolishness protects against shame, just as brazenness protects against poverty.
sprichwort.author: Da Vinci

sprichwort.text: Don't let them get you down, be cheeky, wild, and wonderful!
sprichwort.author: Lindgren

sprichwort.text: Self-confidence is the first step to success.
sprichwort.author: Emerson

sprichwort.text: As soon as we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
sprichwort.author: Einstein

sprichwort.text: Respect yourself, and others will respect you.
sprichwort.author: Confucius

sprichwort.text: Trust is an oasis of the heart that the caravan of thought will never reach.
sprichwort.author: Gibran

sprichwort.text: Vanity feeds on the praise of others; pride is self-sufficient.
sprichwort.author: Kunad

sprichwort.text: It doesn't matter where you live if you are at home within yourself.
sprichwort.author: Schippers

sprichwort.text: Success is the ability to go from one failure to another without losing enthusiasm.
sprichwort.author: Churchill

sprichwort.text: The abuse of greatness is when it separates power from conscience.
sprichwort.author: Shakespeare

sprichwort.text: He who conquers others has strength. He who conquers himself is strong.
sprichwort.author: Lao Tzu

sprichwort.text: Courage is the magic that turns dreams into reality.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.
sprichwort.author: Picasso

sprichwort.text: Knowing what interests you is the prerequisite for getting others interested in it.
sprichwort.author: Pater

sprichwort.text: Curiosity is the best teacher.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Any foolish boy can crush a beetle. But all the professors in the world cannot create one.
sprichwort.author: Schopenhauer

sprichwort.text: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
sprichwort.author: Mahfouz

sprichwort.text: Sometimes a victory surprises no one more than the victor himself.
sprichwort.author: Weiss

sprichwort.text: Eat only when hungry and drink only when thirsty, and in excitement, better throw the food away.
sprichwort.author: Talmud

sprichwort.text: Those who walk through life with open eyes and ears always find reasons to be astonished.
sprichwort.author: Ferstl

sprichwort.text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
sprichwort.author: King

sprichwort.text: The optimist is no less often wrong than the pessimist, but he lives more cheerfully.
sprichwort.author: Rivel

sprichwort.text: Hope is the rainbow over the cascading stream of life.
sprichwort.author: Nietzsche

sprichwort.text: I have no education. I have inspiration. If I were educated, I would be a damn fool.
sprichwort.author: Marley

sprichwort.text: I stand in the belief that it is sometimes not useless to place a certain noble trust in one's own abilities.
sprichwort.author: Kant

sprichwort.text: Our intimacy rested securely on the awareness of numerous inner commonalities.
sprichwort.author: Freud

sprichwort.text: We are guided by our compassion, and the extent of our compassion is determined by our sensitivity.
sprichwort.author: Hazlitt

sprichwort.text: Everyone sees what you seem. Only a few feel what you are.
sprichwort.author: Machiavelli

sprichwort.text: There is no way to peace, for peace is the way.
sprichwort.author: Gandhi

sprichwort.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of all virtues but also the mother of all others.
sprichwort.author: Cicero

sprichwort.text: Love does not make blind. The lover simply sees far more than is there.
sprichwort.author: Hassencamp

sprichwort.text: The only real enemies of a person are their own negative thoughts.
sprichwort.author: Einstein

sprichwort.text: Do not do anything when angry before reciting the alphabet.
sprichwort.author: Voltaire

sprichwort.text: To be furious is to avenge the faults of others on ourselves.
sprichwort.author: Pope

sprichwort.text: I stand speechless before the courage simple people muster in the face of pain and suffering.
sprichwort.author: Bosmans

sprichwort.text: People are like clouds; they pass by and bring rain or sunshine.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: In every happiness, there is a drop of bitterness.
sprichwort.author: Knittel

sprichwort.text: Freedom from envy is the genius of those who have no reason to envy anyone.
sprichwort.author: Altenberg

sprichwort.text: Every outrage has its comic side.
sprichwort.author: Camus

sprichwort.text: I am indignant mostly about what does not bother anyone else.
sprichwort.author: Jung

sprichwort.text: Rebellion is a knot of the heart, not of the mind.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: We are rich only through what we give, and poor only through what we refuse.
sprichwort.author: Emerson

sprichwort.text: Attack can be the best defense, but aggression is the worst defense.
sprichwort.author: Schützbach

sprichwort.text: An artist who does not provoke becomes invisible. Art that does not evoke strong reactions has no value.
sprichwort.author: Dali

sprichwort.text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
sprichwort.author: Wilde

sprichwort.text: We rarely console ourselves over great humiliations—we forget them.
sprichwort.author: Clapiers

sprichwort.text: Crowned today, mocked tomorrow.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Disrespect prevents love from growing.
sprichwort.author: Ou-Chad

sprichwort.text: Loneliness makes us harder on ourselves and more longing for people; in both, it improves character.
sprichwort.author: Nietzsche

sprichwort.text: When one loves, one does not long remember the offense.
sprichwort.author: Dostoevsky

sprichwort.text: Who has betrayed you more often than yourself?
sprichwort.author: Franklin

sprichwort.text: Without betrayal, loyalty would go unnoticed.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.
sprichwort.author: Thomas Fuller

sprichwort.text: Coolness is the art of appearing calm when you are not.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Sometimes, silence is the loudest cry.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: A reserved person is like a closed book; you need patience to read it.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: To be dazed is to be caught between reality and dreams.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Numbness is the body's way of protecting the heart.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.
sprichwort.author: Einstein

sprichwort.text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
sprichwort.author: La Fontaine

sprichwort.text: Frustration is the gap between expectation and reality.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: An offended heart is the breeding ground for resentment.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Embarrassment is the price of admission to the human experience.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy—the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Desperation is sometimes as powerful an inspirer as genius.
sprichwort.author: Disraeli

sprichwort.text: Suffering is optional, but pain is inevitable.
sprichwort.author: Buddhist Proverb

sprichwort.text: Lack of desire is the root of all stagnation.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Motivation is what gets you started; habit is what keeps you going.
sprichwort.author: Rohn

sprichwort.text: Powerlessness is the absence of hope.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
sprichwort.author: May

sprichwort.text: An empty heart is a heavy burden.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
sprichwort.author: Roosevelt

sprichwort.text: Loneliness is the poverty of self; solitude is the richness of self.
sprichwort.author: May

sprichwort.text: Isolation is the sum total of wretchedness to a man.
sprichwort.author: Carlyle

sprichwort.text: Abandonment is the cruelest form of rejection.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity, and change.
sprichwort.author: Brown

sprichwort.text: Bullying builds character like nuclear waste creates superheroes.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Fragility is the price of beauty.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Guilt is the price we pay willingly for doing what we are going to do anyway.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Shame corrodes the very part of us that believes we are capable of change.
sprichwort.author: Brown

sprichwort.text: True contrition is not just regret for the consequences, but regret for the act itself.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Boredom is the root of all evil—the despairing refusal to be oneself.
sprichwort.author: Kierkegaard

sprichwort.text: Indifference is the strongest force in the universe. It makes everything it touches meaningless.
sprichwort.author: Ellison

sprichwort.text: Apathy is the glove into which evil slips its hand.
sprichwort.author: Buechner

sprichwort.text: Fatigue makes cowards of us all.
sprichwort.author: Lombardi

sprichwort.text: A good laugh and a long sleep are the best cures in the doctor’s book.
sprichwort.author: Irish Proverb

sprichwort.text: Lack of focus is the enemy of progress.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Restlessness is discontent—and discontent is the first necessity of progress.
sprichwort.author: Edison

sprichwort.text: Stress is caused by being ‘here’ but wanting to be ‘there.’
sprichwort.author: Tolle

sprichwort.text: Overwhelm is the mind’s way of telling you to slow down.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Control your emotions, or they will control you.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
sprichwort.author: Chinese Proverb

sprichwort.text: Hectic days are the price of ambition.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Suppression of emotions leads to inner turmoil.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow; it empties today of its strength.
sprichwort.author: Ten Boom

sprichwort.text: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
sprichwort.author: Kierkegaard

sprichwort.text: Surprise is the greatest gift life can grant us.
sprichwort.author: Borges

sprichwort.text: Startle not the mind with sudden fears.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Horror is the natural reaction to the unknown.
sprichwort.author: Lovecraft

sprichwort.text: Irritation is the seed of anger.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Feeling threatened is a sign of insecurity.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Nervousness is the price of preparation.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: To be exposed is to be vulnerable, and to be vulnerable is to be alive.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Exclusion is the silent killer of belonging.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Insecurity is the root of all fear.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Helplessness is the first step toward asking for help.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is inconsequential.
sprichwort.author: Aesop

sprichwort.text: Feeling insufficient is the first step toward growth.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Disgust is the guardian of our boundaries.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
sprichwort.author: Hazlitt

sprichwort.text: Disapproval is the shadow of judgment.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Hesitation is the seed of missed opportunities.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Dismissiveness is the armor of the insecure.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
sprichwort.author: Bayly

sprichwort.text: To be appalled is to be awakened to injustice.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Rebuffs are the stepping stones to resilience.
sprichwort.author: Unknown

sprichwort.text: Hatred is the coward's revenge for being intimidated.
sprichwort.author: Shaw
